text: Chris Moleya (born 27 January 1997) is a South African athlete specialising in the high jump. He won a silver medal at the 2018 African Championships and a bronze at the 2015 African Games. His personal best in the event is 2.27 metres set in Rheinau-Freistett (GER) in June 2019. ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |2015 |African Games |Brazzaville, Republic of the Congo |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |2.22 m |- |rowspan=2|2016 |African Championships |Durban, South Africa |6th |2.00 m |- |World U20 Championships |Bydgoszcz, Poland |11th |2.18 m |- |rowspan=3|2018 |World Cup |London, United Kingdom |4th |2.21 m |- |African Championships |Asaba, Nigeria |bgcolor=silver|2nd |2.26 m |- |Continental Cup |Ostrava, Czech Republic |7th |2.15 m |} ==References== Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:South African male high jumpers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2015 African Games Category:African Games bronze medalists for South Africa Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field)
title: Chris Moleya
